example_1: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
example_2: āyām'āvuso, yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamissāma. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato etam'atthaṃ ārocessāma. yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.
example_3: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.
example_4: imassa nu kho, bhante, bhagavatā saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo'ti?

example_1: so tathā vūpakaṭṭho viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ anussarati anuvitakketi
example_2: araññe rukkhamūle vā, suññ'āgāre'va bhikkhavo, anussaretha sambuddhaṃ, bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā.
example_3: ye me petā ñātī sālohitā kālaṅ'katā pasannacittā anussaranti tesaṃ taṃ mahapphalaṃ assa mah'ānisaṃsan'ti
example_4: so anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussarāmi, seyyath'idaṃ, ekam'pi jātiṃ dve'pi jātiyo tisso'pi jātiyo catasso'pi jātiyo pañca'pi jātiyo dasa'pi jātiyo vīsam'pi jātiyo tiṃsam'pi jātiyo

meaning: increases more and more; surpasses; outgrows
example_1: oḷārikassa'pi kho ahaṃ, poṭṭhapāda, attapaṭilābhassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desemi, yathāpaṭipannānaṃ vo saṃkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti
example_2: yañ'hi, brāhmaṇa, diṭṭhaṃ bhāsato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ na bhāsitabban'ti vadāmi.
example_3: yañ'ca khv'āssa, bhante, sīlabbataṃ jīvitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ upaṭṭhānasāraṃ sevato akusalā dhammā parihāyanti, kusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti
example_4: uṭṭhānavato satīmato, sucikammassa nisammakārino, saññatassa dhammajīvino, appamattassa yaso-abhivaḍḍhati.

example_1: yathākathaṃ pana tvaṃ bhikkhu mayā saṃkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāsī'ti
example_2: tath'āhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi yathā ye'me antarāyikā dhammā vuttā bhagavatā te paṭisevato n'ālaṃ antarāyāyā'ti.
example_3: idān'eva pana mayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ evaṃ ājānāma, usmā āyuṃ paṭicca tiṭṭhatī'ti. yathā kathaṃ pan'āvuso, imassa bhāsitassa attho daṭṭhabbo'ti?

meaning: name of an arahant monk; attendant of the Buddha; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in great learning, remembrance, conduct, resoluteness and service
example_1: yāyaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi na c'ābhinato na c'āpanato na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato, vimuttattā ṭhito, ṭhitattā santusito, santusitattā no paritassati. ayaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṃphalo vutto bhagavatā'ti?
example_2: evañ'ca vadehi, sādhu kira, bhante, ayyo ānando yena bhikkhun'upassayo yena sā bhikkhunī ten'upasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā'ti.
example_3: passatha no tumhe, ānanda, taṃ vacanapathaṃ aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?
example_4: etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabb'ūpadhippaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo nirodho nibbānan'ti. ayaṃ vuccata-ananda, nirodhasaññā.

example_1: sace mayaṃ imāhi āpattīhi aññam'aññaṃ kāressāma, siyā'pi taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvatteyya.
example_2: maraṇañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, ariyassa vinaye yo sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattati, maraṇamattañ'h'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, dukkhaṃ yaṃ aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati.
example_3: osāretvā vattabbo, passasi taṃ āpattin'ti? sace passati, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ.
example_4: yassa siyā āpatti so āvikareyya, asantiyā āpattiyā tuṇhī bhavitabbaṃ. tuṇhībhāvena kho pan'āyasmante parisuddhā'ti vedissāmi.

example_1: handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo, vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā'ti. ayaṃ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
example_2: rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati

meaning: proposition; synopsis; statement in brief; summary; introduction
example_1: yaṃ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṃkhittena uddesaṃ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṃ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā vihāraṃ paviṭṭho
example_2: ataramāno'va bhāseyya, no taramāno. janapadaniruttiṃ n'ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n'ātidhāveyyā'ti, ayam'uddeso araṇavibhaṅgassa.
example_3: dhārehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhadd'ekarattassa uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca.

example_1: ete te, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.
example_2: tasmā evaṃ samannāgato bhikkhu iminā paramena upasam'ādhiṭṭhānena samannāgato hoti. eso hi, bhikkhu, paramo ariyo upasamo yadidaṃ, rāgadosamohānaṃ upasamo.
example_3: sa ve vitakkāni vicāritāni, sameti vuṭṭhī'va rajaṃ samūhataṃ, sa ve vitakk'ūpasamena cetasā, idh'eva so santipadaṃ samajjhagā'ti.

example_1: āraddhavīriyassa uppajjati pīti nirāmisā
example_2: imasmiṃ sati idaṃ hoti, imass'uppādā idaṃ uppajjati. imasmiṃ asati idaṃ na hoti, imassa nirodhā idaṃ nirujjhati
example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, saradasamaye thullaphusitake deve vassante udake udakabubbuḷaṃ uppajjati c'eva nirujjhati ca.
example_4: evañ'hi tvaṃ, gahapati, pucchasi, yā imā, bhante thera, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, sassato loko'ti

example_1: dukkhan'ti khandhe paṭipassa yoniso, yato ca dukkhaṃ samudeti taṃ jaha, idh'eva dukkhassa karohi antaṃ, itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.
example_2: so karohi dīpam'attano, khippaṃ vāyama paṇḍito bhava, niddhantamalo anaṅgaṇo, dibbaṃ ariyabhūmiṃ upehisi.
example_3: tena hi, gahapati, suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti
example_4: yaṃ te, ambho purisa, karaṇīyaṃ taṃ karohī'ti.

meaning: name of the people of Kosala; Kosalans
example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ sambahulā bhikkhū, kosalesu viharanti himavantapasse araññakuṭikāya uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā pākat'indriyā.
example_2: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena icchānaṅgalaṃ nāma kosalānaṃ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
example_3: yadā pana mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ suṇāma, kosalehi mallesu cārikaṃ pakkamissatī'ti, hoti no tasmiṃ samaye anattamanatā hoti domanassaṃ, dūre no bhagavā bhavissatī'ti.

example_1: ayasā'va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ, tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati, evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ, sāni kammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.
example_2: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, biḷāro sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīre ṭhito ahosi mudumūsiṃ maggayamāno, yadā'yaṃ mudumūsi gocarāya pakkamissati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā khādissāmī'ti.
example_3: handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.
example_4: seyyathā'pi yaṃ yadeva hi sā gāvī niccammā nissāya tiṭṭheyya, ye tan'nissitā pāṇā te naṃ khādeyyuṃ. evam'eva khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, phass'āhāro daṭṭhabbo'ti

example_1: taṃ dhammaṃ suṇāti gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aññatarasmiṃ vā kule paccājāto.
example_2: evañ'hi tvaṃ, gahapati, pucchasi, yā imā, bhante thera, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, sassato loko'ti
example_3: tha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.
example_4: bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpeyya, tatra ce so bhikkhu pubbe appavārito tantavāye upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjeyya

example_1: bhikkhuṃ pan'eva uddissa aññātakassa gahapatissa vā gahapatāniyā vā cīvaracetāpannaṃ upakkhaṭaṃ hoti, iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan'nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī'ti
idha, bhikkhu, paṇḍito mahāpañño n'ev'attabyābādhāya ceteti na parabyābādhāya ceteti na ubhayabyābādhāya ceteti attahitaparahitaubhayahitasabbalokahitam'eva cintayamāno cinteti
example_2: asañcetanikaṃ, bhante, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto no mahāsāvajjaṃ paññapetī'ti. sace pana, gahapati, cetetī'ti? mahāsāvajjaṃ, bhante, hotī'ti.
example_3: sace so assutavā puthujjano āyatiṃ punabbhavāya ceteti, evañ'hi so moghapuriso suhatataro hoti, seyyathā'pi sā yavakalāpī sattamāya byābhaṅgiyā haññamānā.
example_4: sace kho pana karoto karīyati pāpaṃ, na kho pan'āhaṃ kassaci pāpaṃ cetemi. akarontaṃ kho pana maṃ pāpakammaṃ kuto dukkhaṃ phusissatī'ti

example_1: sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti, sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti, sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti, taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

meaning: name of a Brahman royal advisor
example_1: rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati
te ca kho hatthapāsaṃ avijahitvā ekasīmāyaṃ ṭhitā.
example_2: kiñ'ca n'eva pajahati na upādiyati pajahitvā ṭhito? rūpaṃ ... vedanaṃ ... saññaṃ ... saṃkhare ... viññāṇaṃ n'eva pajahati na upādiyati pajahitvā ṭhito
example_3: so tattha ṭhito āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇāti
example_4: ṭhite majjhanhike kāle, sannisīvesu pakkhisu, saṇat'eva brah'āraññaṃ, taṃ bhayaṃ paṭibhāti man'ti.

meaning: in that regard; in that case; regarding that matter
example_1: tattha katame avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā? puññ'ābhisaṅkhāro, apuññ'ābhisaṅkhāro, āneñj'ābhisaṅkhāro, kāyasaṅkhāro, vacīsaṅkhāro, cittasaṅkhāro.
example_2: rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, upādāniyo dhammo, yo tattha chandarāgo, taṃ tattha upādānaṃ.
example_3: so yadeva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati
example_4: so tattha ṭhito āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇāti

example_1: sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbesaṃ jīvitaṃ piyaṃ, attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā, na haneyya na ghātaye.
example_2: sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno, attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā, na haneyya na ghātaye.

example_1: yāya devā manussā ca, sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā, tarath'etaṃ visattikaṃ, khaṇo vo mā upaccagā, khaṇ'ātītā hi socanti, nirayamhi samappitā.
example_2: manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā. tañ'ce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati. tassa taṃ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato uppajjati nandī.
example_3: yaṃ kiñci sampajānāsi, uddhaṃ adho tiriyañ'cā'pi majjhe, etesu nandiñ'ca nivesanañ'ca, panujja viññāṇaṃ bhave na tiṭṭhe.

example_1: nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī day'āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī viharati.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci pāṇinā pahāraṃ dadeyya, leḍḍunā pahāraṃ dadeyya, daṇḍena pahāraṃ dadeyya, satthena pahāraṃ dadeyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.
example_3: sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbesaṃ jīvitaṃ piyaṃ, attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā, na haneyya na ghātaye.
example_4: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, daṇḍo uparivehāsaṃ khitto sakim'pi mūlena nipatati, sakim'pi aggena nipatati

meaning: view; belief; opinion; concept; theory; attitude; philosophy; credo; creed; dogma
example_1: sahā'v'assa dassanasampadāya, taya'ssu dhammā jahitā bhavanti. sakkāyadiṭṭhi vicikicchitañ'ca, sīlabbataṃ vā pi yadatthi kiñci.
example_2: visenikatvā pana ye caranti, diṭṭhīhi diṭṭhiṃ avirujjhamānā, tesu tvaṃ kiṃ labhetho pasūra, yes'īdha n'atthī param'uggahītaṃ.
example_3: na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, mun'īdha nanda kusalā vadanti, visenikatvā anīghā nirāsā, caranti ye te munayoti brūmi.
example_4: evañ'hi tvaṃ, gahapati, pucchasi, yā imā, bhante thera, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, sassato loko'ti

meaning: taste of the Dhamma; flavour of the Dhamma
example_1: sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti, sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti, sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti, taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.

meaning: bears in mind; keeps in mind; remembers
example_1: ek'aṃsena, gotami, dhāreyyāsi, eso dhammo, eso vinayo, etaṃ satthusāsanan'ti
example_2: bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.
example_3: maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajja't'agge pāṇ'upetaṃ saraṇaṃ gataṃ
example_4: dhārehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhadd'ekarattassa uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca.

meaning: (of mental defilement) complete quenching; total emancipation; complete cooling
example_1: ete te, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati
example_2: tiṭṭhat'eva nibbānaṃ, tiṭṭhati nibbānagāmī maggo
example_3: ārogyaparamā lābhā, nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ, aṭṭh'aṅgiko ca maggānaṃ, khemaṃ amatagāminan'ti.
example_4: katamā ca, bhikkhave, ariyā pariyesanā? idha, bhikkhave, ekacco ... attanā byādhidhammo samāno byādhidhamme ādīnavaṃ viditvā abyādhiṃ anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ nibbānaṃ pariyesati

example_1: so santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena. so yena yen'eva pakkamati, samādāy'eva pakkamati
example_2: so taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā ubhohi hatthehi itic'iti ca sevālapaṇakaṃ apaviyūhitvā añjalinā pivitvā pakkameyya.
example_3: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubb'upagataṃ bhikkhuṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeyya yassa sambādho bhavissati, so pakkamissatī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
example_4: yadā pana mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ suṇāma, kosalehi mallesu cārikaṃ pakkamissatī'ti, hoti no tasmiṃ samaye anattamanatā hoti domanassaṃ, dūre no bhagavā bhavissatī'ti.

example_1: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opanayiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi
example_2: saddhammapūjā'pi nesaṃ tath'eva, yathā pasaṃsanti sak'āyanāni, sabb'eva vādā tathiyā bhaveyyuṃ, suddhī hi nesaṃ paccattam'eva.
example_3: so evaṃ asamanupassanto na kiñci loke upādiyati, anupādiyaṃ na paritassati, aparitassaṃ paccattaññ'eva parinibbāyati.
example_4: imaṃ nu kho ahaṃ diṭṭhiṃ āsevanto bhāvento bahulīkaronto labhāmi paccattaṃ samathaṃ, labhāmi paccattaṃ nibbutin'ti?

example_1: akusalaṃ, bhikkhave, pajahatha. sakkā, bhikkhave, akusalaṃ pajahituṃ. no c'etaṃ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa akusalaṃ pajahituṃ, n'āhaṃ evaṃ vadeyyaṃ, akusalaṃ, bhikkhave, pajahathā'ti.
example_2: bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.
example_3: yo saṅkhāresu chandarāgo taṃ pajahatha. evaṃ te saṅkhārā pahīnā bhavissanti ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā.
example_4: ye'pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti dukkhato dakkhissanti anattato dakkhissanti rogato dakkhissanti bhayato dakkhissanti, te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti.

example_1: ime sakkāre duggatapaṇṇ'ākārabhūte paṭiggaṇhātu amhākaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma suddhaṃ vatthaṃ apagatakāḷakaṃ samma'd'eva rajanaṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, evam'eva tesaṃ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṃ tasmiṃ'y'eva āsane virajaṃ vītamalaṃ dhammacakkhuṃ udapādi
example_3: so ce dūto taṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, idaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmantaṃ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṃ ābhataṃ, paṭiggaṇhātu āyasmā cīvaracetāpannan'ti.

meaning: comes to mind; occurs (to); inspires (someone to)
example_1: ko pana, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo yen'ekadā dīgharattaṃ asajjhāyakatā'pi mantā paṭibhanti, pag'eva sajjhāyakatā'ti?
example_2: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.
example_3: ṭhite majjhanhike kāle, sannisīvesu pakkhisu, saṇat'eva brah'āraññaṃ, taṃ bhayaṃ paṭibhāti man'ti.

example_1: so taṃ dhammaṃ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṃ paṭilabhati. so tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati
example_2: yattha pana mahantaṃ paribhavaṃ paṭilabhati, tattha ciram'pi vasati. so nivatth'avatthe jiṇṇe pilotikakhaṇḍena tasmim'pi jiṇṇe kenaci dinnaṃ aggaṇhanto hirikopīnapaṭicchādanamatten'eva carati. evaṃ gacchante kāle ekaṃ nigamagāmaṃ agamāsi.

example_1: sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti
example_2: so iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṃ anavajjasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti

example_1: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cīvaraṃ paṭisevati, yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya, uṇhassa paṭighātāya, ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassānaṃ paṭighātāya, yāva'd'eva hirikopīnappaṭicchādanatthaṃ
passatha no tumhe ... taṃ vacanapathaṃ aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?
example_2: tato pāsādikaṃ āsi, gataṃ bhuttaṃ nisevitaṃ. siniddhā teladhārā'va, ahosi iriyāpatho.
example_3: iriyāpathapabbaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ

example_1: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva uppannānaṃ veyyābādhikānaṃ vedanānaṃ paṭighātāya abyāpajjhaparamatāyā
example_2: yesañ'ca mayaṃ paribhuñjāma cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti
example_3: anāpatti cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhārena upaṭṭhahā'ti bhaṇati, ummattakassa ādikammikassā'ti.

example_1: āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave, sukhaṃ viharati pavivitto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ'ca sadatthaṃ paripūreti.
example_2: ye keci buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatāse, na te gamissanti apāyabhūmiṃ, pahāya mānusaṃ dehaṃ, devakāyaṃ paripūressantī'ti.
example_3: so imam'eva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti

example_1: lesakappe pariyāye, parikappe'nudhāvitā. jīvik'atthā upāyena, saṅkaḍḍhanti bahuṃ dhanaṃ.
example_2: yena yena hi maññanti, tato taṃ hoti aññathā, etādiso vinābhāvo, passa lokassa pariyāyaṃ.

example_1: passa cittakataṃ bimbaṃ, arukāyaṃ samussitaṃ, āturaṃ bahusaṅkappaṃ, yassa n'atthi dhuvaṃ ṭhiti.
example_2: yena yena hi maññanti, tato taṃ hoti aññathā, etādiso vinābhāvo, passa lokassa pariyāyaṃ.

example_1: yo ca buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca, saṅghañ'ca saraṇaṃ gato, cattāri ariyasaccāni, sammappaññāya passati.
example_2: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā'ti?
example_3: passatha no tumhe, ānanda, taṃ vacanapathaṃ aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?
example_4: sukhaṃ supati, sukhaṃ paṭibujjhati, na pāpakaṃ supinaṃ passati, manussānaṃ ca amanussānaṃ piyo hoti, devatā rakkhanti

example_1: atha kho bhagavā parittaṃ udak'āvasesaṃ udak'ādhāne ṭhapetvā āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, passasi no tvaṃ, rāhula, imaṃ parittaṃ udak'āvasesaṃ udak'ādhāne ṭhapitan'ti?
example_2: bhūtam'idan'ti, sāriputta, passasī'ti? bhūtam'idan'ti, bhante, yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya passati.
example_3: osāretvā vattabbo, passasi taṃ āpattin'ti? sace passati, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ.

example_1: ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu sīlavā hohi pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi
example_2: akittayī vivaṭacakkhu, sakkhidhammaṃ parissayavinayaṃ, paṭipadaṃ vadehi bhaddante, pātimokkhaṃ athavā'pi samādhiṃ.
example_3: anūpavādo anūpaghāto, pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro, mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ, pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ, adhicitte ca āyogo, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

example_1: atha kho, āvuso, rājā pasenadi kosalo sāvatthiyā nikkhamitvā antepuradvārā paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya, paṭhamena rathavinītena dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ pāpuṇeyya, paṭhamaṃ rathavinītaṃ vissajjeyya dutiyaṃ rathavinītaṃ abhiruheyya.
example_2: so tattha ṭhito āsavānaṃ khayaṃ pāpuṇāti
example_3: vedanaṃ pharusaṃ jāniṃ, sarīrassa ca bhedanaṃ, garukaṃ vā'pi ābādhaṃ, cittakkhepañ'ca pāpuṇe.

example_1: yadidaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā
example_2: katamo ca, bhikkhave, bhārahāro? puggalo tissa vacanīyaṃ. yv'āyaṃ āyasmā evaṃnāmo evaṃgotto. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhārahāro.
example_3: evaṃ tasmiṃ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo. samantapāsādikaṃ, āvuso, puggalaṃ āgamma cittaṃ pasīdati.
example_4: yañ'c'assa sārena sārakaraṇīyaṃ tañ'c'assa atthaṃ n'ānubhavissati. tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.

example_1: siyā kho pana bhikkhave ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā pucchatha bhikkhave mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha
example_2: anejaṃ mūladassāviṃ, atthi pañhena āgamaṃ, kiṃ nissitā isayo manujā, khattiyā brāhmaṇā devatānaṃ, yaññam'akappayiṃsu puthū'dha loke, pucchāmi taṃ bhagavā brūhi me taṃ.
example_3: evañ'hi tvaṃ, gahapati, pucchasi, yā imā, bhante thera, anekavihitā diṭṭhiyo loke uppajjanti, sassato loko'ti
example_4: idha no, bhante, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā amhe evaṃ pucchanti, kim'atthiyaṃ, āvuso, samaṇe gotame brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti?

example_1: mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ, āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe, evam'pi sabbabhūtesu, mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.
example_2: mātāpitu upaṭṭhānaṃ, puttadārassa saṅgaho. anākulā ca kamm'antā, etam'maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
example_3: taṃ dhammaṃ suṇāti gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aññatarasmiṃ vā kule paccājāto.
example_4: ye pana te kulaputtā saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitā asaṭhā amāyāvino aketabino anuddhatā anunnaḷā acapalā amukharā avikiṇṇavācā ... tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

meaning: common man; ordinary man; normal person; man in the street
example_1: diṭṭhisaṃyojanasaṃyutto, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano na parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, na parimuccati dukkhasmā'ti vadāmi
example_2: hitvā icchañ'ca lobhañ'ca, yattha satto puthujjano, cakkhumā paṭipajjeyya, tareyya narakaṃ imaṃ.
example_3: sace so assutavā puthujjano āyatiṃ punabbhavāya ceteti, evañ'hi so moghapuriso suhatataro hoti
example_4: eko pubbe caritvāna, methunaṃ yo nisevati, yānaṃ bhantaṃ va taṃ loke, hīnam'āhu puthujjanaṃ.

meaning: appearing again; renewed existence; rebirth; future life
example_1: ñāṇañ'ca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi. akuppā me vimutti, ayam'antimā jāti, n'atthi dāni punabbhavo'ti
example_2: yassa kho brāhmaṇa āyatiṃ gabbhaseyyā punabbhava-abhinibbatti pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl'āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā tam'ahaṃ apagabbhoti vadāmi
example_3: sace so assutavā puthujjano āyatiṃ punabbhavāya ceteti, evañ'hi so moghapuriso suhatataro hoti, seyyathā'pi sā yavakalāpī sattamāya byābhaṅgiyā haññamānā.

example_1: taṃ kho pana bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato
example_2: es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca.
example_3: na arahati bhavaṃ kūṭadanto samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṃ. samaṇo tv'eva gotamo arahati bhavantaṃ kūṭadantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṃ

example_1: na ca katthitā siyā bhikkhu, na ca vācaṃ payuttaṃ bhāseyya, pāgabbhiyaṃ na sikkheyya, kathaṃ viggāhikaṃ na kathayeyya.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, phagguna, tava ce'pi koci sammukhā avaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya, tatr'āpi tvaṃ, phagguna, ye gehasitā chandā ye gehasitā vitakkā te pajaheyyāsi.
example_3: manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā, manoseṭṭhā manomayā. manasā ce paduṭṭhena, bhāsati vā karoti vā. tato naṃ dukkham'anveti, cakkaṃ'va vahato padaṃ.
example_4: evam'etaṃ mahāvīra, yathā samaṇa bhāsasi. ettha c'eke visīdanti, paṅkamhi'va jaraggavo.

example_1: etha, tumhe'pi, bhikkhave, ek'āsanabhojanaṃ bhuñjatha. ek'āsanabhojanaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi bhuñjamānā app'ābādhatañ'ca sañjānissatha app'ātaṅkatañ'ca lah'uṭṭhānañ'ca balañ'ca phāsuvihārañ'cā'ti.
example_2: ahaṃ kho, samaṇa, kasāmi ca vapāmi ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjāmi. tvam'pi, samaṇa, kasassu ca vapassu ca. kasitvā ca vapitvā ca bhuñjassū'ti.
example_3: handa bhikkhu khāda vā bhuñja vā'ti jānaṃ āsādan'āpekkho, bhuttasmiṃ pācittiyaṃ.
example_4: yo pana bhikkhu, bhuttāvī pavārito, anatirittaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

example_1: rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappeyyāsi pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasikaritvā
example_2: rūpaṃ disvā sati muṭṭhā, piyaṃ nimittaṃ manasi karoto, sārattacitto vedeti, tañ'ca ajjhosa tiṭṭhati.
example_3: tena bhikkhunā tamhā nimittā aññaṃ nimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ kusal'ūpasaṃhitaṃ.
example_4: taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha. bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti kho therā bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

example_1: kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi nittharaṇ'atthāya, no gahaṇ'atthāya. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.
example_2: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, imaṃ kakac'ūpamaṃ ovādaṃ abhikkhaṇaṃ manasikarotha. taṃ vo bhavissati dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.

meaning: name of the people of Malla; Mallans
example_1: assosuṃ kho pāveyyakā mallā bhagavā kira kusinārāyaṃ parinibbuto'ti
example_2: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā mallesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena thūṇaṃ nāma mallānaṃ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
example_3: yadā pana mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ suṇāma, kosalehi mallesu cārikaṃ pakkamissatī'ti, hoti no tasmiṃ samaye anattamanatā hoti domanassaṃ, dūre no bhagavā bhavissatī'ti.

meaning: young man; young gentleman; young Brahman
example_1: dumapphalānī'va patanti māṇavā, daharā ca vuḍḍhā ca sarīrabhedā. etam'pi disvā pabbajito'mhi rāja, apaṇṇakaṃ sāmaññam'eva seyyo.
example_2: bhavam'atthu bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ, rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo'ti
example_3: tassa taṃ vacanaṃ sutvā, abbhutaṃ lomahaṃsanaṃ, satthāni nikkhipitvāna, māṇavā etadabravuṃ.

example_1: jivhā ādittā, rasā ādittā, jivhāviññāṇaṃ ādittaṃ, jivhāsamphasso āditto
example_2: sotena saddaṃ sutvā …pe… ghānena gandhaṃ ghāyitvā …pe… jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā …pe… kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṃ phusitvā …pe
example_3: sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti, sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti, sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti, taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.
example_4: dūtena saṃvaṇṇeti, lekhāya saṃvaṇṇeti, opātaṃ apassenaṃ, upanikkhipanaṃ, bhesajjaṃ, rūp'ūpahāro, sadd'ūpahāro, gandh'ūpahāro, ras'ūpahāro, phoṭṭhabb'ūpahāro, dhamm'ūpahāro, ācikkhanā, anusāsanī, saṅketakammaṃ, nimittakamman'ti.

example_1: rājā ca aññe ca bahū manussā, avītataṇhā maraṇaṃ upenti. ūnā'va hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ, kāmehi lokamhi na h'atthi titti.
example_2: no ce labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ, saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ, rājā'va raṭṭhaṃ vijitaṃ pahāya, eko care mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo.
example_3: rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati

example_1: appiyehi sampayogo dukkho, piyehi vippayogo dukkho, yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ
example_2: evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.
example_3: no ce labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ, saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ, rājā'va raṭṭhaṃ vijitaṃ pahāya, eko care mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo.
example_4: imaṃ nu kho ahaṃ diṭṭhiṃ āsevanto bhāvento bahulīkaronto labhāmi paccattaṃ samathaṃ, labhāmi paccattaṃ nibbutin'ti?

example_1: sabbadānaṃ dhammadānaṃ jināti, sabbarasaṃ dhammaraso jināti, sabbaratiṃ dhammarati jināti, taṇhakkhayo sabbadukkhaṃ jināti.
sabbe saddhammagaruno, vihariṃsu viharanti ca. atho'pi viharissanti, esā buddhāna dhammatā.
example_2: sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbesaṃ jīvitaṃ piyaṃ. attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā, na haneyya na ghātaye.
example_3: kiṃ nu kho bhoto gotamassa sāvakā bhotā gotamena evaṃ ovadīyamānā evaṃ anusāsīyamānā sabbe accantaṃ niṭṭhaṃ nibbānaṃ ārādhenti udāhu ekacce n'ārādhentī'ti?

meaning: stilling (of); serenity (of); calming (of); settling (of); peace (of); (comm) mental unification
example_1: imaṃ nu kho ahaṃ diṭṭhiṃ āsevanto bhāvento bahulīkaronto labhāmi paccattaṃ samathaṃ, labhāmi paccattaṃ nibbutin'ti?
example_2: atthi, bhikkhave, samathanimittaṃ abyagganimittaṃ. tattha yonisomanasikārabahulīkāro, ayam'āhāro anuppannassa vā samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa uppādāya, uppannassa vā samādhisambojjh'aṅgassa bhāvanāya pāripūriyā.

example_1: cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati
example_2: dhammo ca desito niyyāniko upasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito
example_3: ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.

meaning: shelter; refuge; help; epithet of Nibbāna
example_1: yo ca buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca, saṅghañ'ca saraṇaṃ gato, cattāri ariyasaccāni, sammappaññāya passati.
example_2: n'etaṃ kho saraṇaṃ khemaṃ, n'etaṃ saraṇam'uttamaṃ, n'etaṃ saraṇam'āgamma, sabbadukkhā pamuccati.
example_3: es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca.
example_4: bhikkhū'ti bhikkhako'ti bhikkhu, bhikkhācariyaṃ ajjhupagato'ti bhikkhu, bhinnapaṭadharo'ti bhikkhu, samaññāya bhikkhu, paṭiññāya bhikkhu, ehi bhikkhū'ti bhikkhu, tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampanno'ti bhikkhu

example_1: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.
example_2: ete te, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati
example_3: yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, akusalaṃ pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya saṃvattati tasm'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, akusalaṃ, bhikkhave, pajahathā'ti.
example_4: saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

example_1: ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharāhi ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū'ti
example_2: anūpavādo anūpaghāto, pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro, mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ, pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ, adhicitte ca āyogo, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

meaning: it is good (for); it would be good (if)
example_1: sādhu no bhante bhagavā suciraparinibbuto'pi pacchimājanat'ānukampamānasā
example_2: sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu, yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā ekā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpinī pahit'attā vihareyyan'ti
example_3: na taṃ kammaṃ kataṃ sādhu, yaṃ katvā anutappati, yassa assumukho rodaṃ, vipākaṃ paṭisevati.
example_4: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.

example_1: anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
example_2: so tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti
example_3: tena hi, bhikkhave, suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.
example_4: kiṃ saṅghassa pubbakiccaṃ? pārisuddhiṃ āyasmanto ārocetha, pātimokkhaṃ uddisissāmi, taṃ sabb'eva santā sādhukaṃ suṇoma manasi karoma.

meaning: name of an arahant monk; chief disciple; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in great wisdom
example_1: āraddhavīriyo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vattā, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vacanakkhamo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. codako, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. pāpagarahī, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.
example_2: evaṃ vutte, āyasmā puṇṇo mantāṇiputto āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca, ko nāmo āyasmā, kathañ'ca pan'āyasmantaṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti? upatisso'ti kho me, āvuso, nāmaṃ, sāriputto'ti ca pana maṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti.
example_3: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.
example_4: sādh'āvuso'ti kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ uttariṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.

example_1: pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañ'ca kāyena paṭisaṃvedeti, yaṃ taṃ ariyā ācikkhanti, upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī'ti tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
example_2: bhārā have pañcakkhandhā, bhārahāro ca puggalo. bhār'ādānaṃ dukhaṃ loke, bhāranikkhepanaṃ sukhaṃ.
example_3: sukhakāmāni bhūtāni, yo daṇḍena vihiṃsati, attano sukham'esāno, pecca so na labhate sukhaṃ.
example_4: yaṃ, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ, taṃ pajahatha. taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.

example_1: taṃ dhammaṃ suṇāti gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aññatarasmiṃ vā kule paccājāto.
example_2: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā dhammassavane. katame pañca? assutaṃ suṇāti, sutaṃ pariyodāpeti, kaṅkhaṃ vitarati, diṭṭhiṃ ujuṃ karoti, cittam'assa pasīdati.
example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, rañño vā rājamahāmattassa vā vīṇāya saddo assutapubbo assa. so vīṇāsaddaṃ suṇeyya. so evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kassa nu kho eso saddo evaṃrajanīyo evaṃkamanīyo evaṃmadanīyo evaṃmucchanīyo evaṃbandhanīyo'ti?
example_4: idha saddhājāto upasaṅkamati, upasaṅkamanto payirupāsati, payirupāsanto sotaṃ odahati, ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti, sutvā dhammaṃ dhāreti, dhatānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhati,

meaning: one must listen!; it must hear!
example_1: yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni, bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe. sabb'eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu, atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.
example_2: suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
example_3: taṃ suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī'ti.

example_1: yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo. tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
example_2: satiñ'ca khv'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabb'atthikaṃ vadāmī'ti.
example_3: yañ'c'assa sārena sārakaraṇīyaṃ tañ'c'assa atthaṃ n'ānubhavissati. tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
example_4: tam'enaṃ tvaṃ evaṃ vadeyyāsi, eh'ambho purisa, ayaṃ maggo rājagahaṃ gacchati. tena muhuttaṃ gaccha, tena muhuttaṃ gantvā dakkhissasi amukaṃ nāma gāmaṃ

example_1: handa mayaṃ paṭiccasamuppādavibhaṅgaṃ bhaṇāmase
example_2: so vuccati yoggācariyānaṃ anuttaro purisadammasārathī'ti, ayam'uddeso saḷ'āyatanavibhaṅgassa.
example_3: dhārehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhadd'ekarattassa uddesañ'ca vibhaṅgañ'ca.

meaning: born from seclusion; (or) born from discrimination; (comm) secluded from the defilements
example_1: vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
example_2: so imam'eva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati, n'āssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti.

example_1: asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgat'āgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā. tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ
example_2: te ce me evaṃ puṭṭhā, āmā'ti paṭijānanti, ty'āhaṃ evaṃ vadāmi, api pana tumhe āyasmanto ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ jānaṃ passaṃ viharathā'ti? iti puṭṭhā, no'ti vadanti.
example_3: devo ca vassati devo ca gaḷagaḷāyati, ekako c'āhaṃ bherave bile viharāmi, tassa mayhaṃ ekakassa bherave bile viharato, n'atthi bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā.
example_4: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati pubb'ārāme migāramātupāsāde. atha kho gaṇakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

meaning: having delight and ease; with joy and happiness
example_1: vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
